quoteFirst: As soon therefore as the last of his reinforcements arrived from De-Aar, he resolved to attack the Magersfontein kopje.  For this purpose, as we have said, the heights were bombarded from 4.50 P.M. to
quoteLast: on the 10th December, in the expectation that--judging from the moral effect produced by his guns in the three previous actions, and the anticipated effect of lyddite, to be used for the first time--there would not only be great destruction of life in the trenches, but a considerable demoralising effect on the enemy's nerves.  {185} Whether this was so is doubtful.
title: General Wauchope
author: Baird, William, F.S.A. Scot.

quoteFirst: the hours of setting. On the 16th, day breaks at 5:40 a. m., and twilight ends at
quoteLast: , giving just thirteen hours between “early dawn and dewy eve.” The sun is slower than the clock, on the 1st, being on the meridian at three minutes and thirty-eight seconds past twelve, and on the 31st reaching the meridian thirteen minutes and forty-seven seconds after the clock indicates noon.
